What are some additional capabilities that Verus offers?

Verus offers several additional capabilities, including on-chain launches of tokens, centralized currencies, and liquidity basket AMMs, as well as on-chain launches and merge mining of independent, connected, interoperable blockchains without programming. It also offers on-chain self-sovereign, provable identities, NFTs, and individual or organizational profiles.

# Additional Verus Capabilities
- On-chain Launches of Token, Centralized Currency, and Liquidity Basket AMMs
- On-chain Launches and Merge Mining of Independent, Connected, Interoperable Blockchains without Programming
- On-chain Self Sovereign, Provable Identities, NFTs, and Individual or Organizational Profiles### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.

What is the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and how does it work?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform that allows users to buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs on-chain. Users can advertise their offers directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post the sale of their NFT on the blockchain for everyone to see. Transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, allowing users to pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address. The platform also allows owners to select and share proceeds with value-added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in the digital ownership economy.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it protect funds on a VerusID?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to lock their VerusID, protecting funds from theft even if a private key is compromised. When a VerusID is locked with Vault, the user cannot spend funds from that identity until it is unlocked again. However, they can still stake those funds on the Verus network and earn rewards. Additionally, users can still receive funds while their VerusID is locked.

What are the requirements for enabling revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID?
To enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID, users must have at least one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured.
